findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop transactions for all users excluding themselves by setting `_maxTxAmount` to zero, potentially operating as a honeypot.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling either of the following functions with a high percentage value: setTaxFeePercent, setDevFeePercent, or setLiquidityFeePercent.

findings.title: PRV - Potential Router Vulnerability
findings.description: The contract includes a method that allows the owner to modify the router address and create a new pair, potentially introducing malicious code.

findings.title: RED - Redundant Event Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares certain events in its code. However, these events are not emitted within the contract's functions. As a result, these declared events are redundant and serve no purpose within the contract's current implementation.

findings.title: EPC - Existing Pair Creation
findings.description: The contract contains a function that does not handle the scenario where a pair already exists prior to its execution.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but if `numTokensSellToAddToLiquidity` is set too high, it may trigger a huge token sale, potentially leading to significant price volatility and transaction failure.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. The `immutable` declaration saves gas when it is defined.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of prediction.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be error-prone and requires careful testing and debugging to ensure correctness.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version (i.e., any version that is a higher minor or patch version) can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
